Sentencas: The concept of combining electrical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) with environmental transmission electron microscopy (ETEM) is demonstrated by testing a specially designed micro gadolinia-doped ceria (CGO) sample in reactive gasses (O-2 and H-2/H2O), at elevated temperatures (room temperature-800 degrees C) and with applied electrical potentials.
Titulo: Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy Integrated with Environmental Transmission Electron Microscopy

Sentencas: The EIS-TEM method provides structural and compositional information with direct correlation to the electrochemical performance.
Titulo: Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy Integrated with Environmental Transmission Electron Microscopy

Sentencas: It is demonstrated that reliable EIS measurements can be achieved in the TEM for a sample with nanoscale dimensions.
Titulo: Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy Integrated with Environmental Transmission Electron Microscopy

Sentencas: Specifically, the ionic and electronic conductivity, the surface exchange resistivity, and the volume-specific chemical capacitance are in good agreement with results from more standardized electrochemical tests on macroscopic samples.
Titulo: Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy Integrated with Environmental Transmission Electron Microscopy

Sentencas: CGO is chosen as a test material due to its relevance for solid oxide electrochemical reactions where its electrochemical performance depends on temperature and gas environment.
Titulo: Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy Integrated with Environmental Transmission Electron Microscopy

Sentencas: As expected, the results show increased conductivity and lower surface exchange resistance in H-2/H2O gas mixtures where the oxygen partial pressure is low compared to experiments in pure O-2.
Titulo: Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy Integrated with Environmental Transmission Electron Microscopy

Sentencas: The developed EIS-TEM platform is an important tool in promoting the understanding of nanoscale processes for green energy technologies, e.g., solid oxide electrolysis/fuel cells, batteries, thermoelectric devices, etc.
Titulo: Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy Integrated with Environmental Transmission Electron Microscopy
